name: Yuan-Fang Li
content: Yuan-Fang Li - Monash University Yuan-Fang Li public CV View Scopus Profile Yuan-Fang Li Assoc Professor Associate Professor, Department of Data Science & AI https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4651-2821 EmailYuanFang.Limonashedu Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectshttps://supervisorconnect.it.monash.edu/ 20022026 Research activity per year Personal profile Research interestsYuan-Fang Li (李元放) is an Associate Professor in the Department of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS+AI), Faculty of Information Technology, Monash University. He is also the Associate Dean International of the Faculty. Yuan-Fang's research interests include knowledge graphs, natural language processing, multimodality, and representation learning (embedding) of networks/graphs. Some of the research problems he works on include: Complex question answering over text and knowledge graphs.Knowledge extraction from other modalities: e.g. event/relation extraction from text and scene graph generation from images.Structural & temporal learning on graphs.Question generation from text & knowledge graphs. Related Links: More information can be found at Yuan-Fang's personal homepage. Monash teaching commitmentYuan-Fang has experience as the Chief Examiner for the following units in the Faculty of IT: FIT4002 Software engineering studio projectFIT4004/FIT5171 System validation and verification, quality and standardsFIT5138 Advanced Software EngineeringFIT3013 Formal specification for software engineeringFIT4008 Reading unitMinor thesis, Masters thesis and Honours thesis units Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
